Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only astronomical object known to harbour life. According to radiometric dating estimation and other evidence, Earth formed over 4.5 billion years ago. Earth's gravity interacts with other objects in space, especially the Sun and the Moon, which is Earth's only natural satellite. Earth orbits around the Sun in about 365.25 days.

Earth's axis of rotation is tilted with respect to its orbital plane, producing seasons on Earth. The gravitational interaction between Earth and the Moon causes tides, stabilises Earth's orientation on its axis, and gradually slows its rotation.

attributes.title: The Complete Guide to WordPress Development
attributes.content:
WordPress powers over 40% of all websites on the internet, making it the most popular content management system (CMS) in the world. Whether you're building a simple blog or a complex enterprise application, WordPress provides the flexibility and tools you need.

Getting Started with WordPress

To begin your WordPress journey, you'll need to understand the core concepts: themes, plugins, posts, and pages. Each component plays a crucial role in creating a successful website.

Theme Development

WordPress themes control the visual presentation of your site. Modern theme development involves HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP. The block editor (Gutenberg) has revolutionized theme development with block-based templates.

Plugin Development

Plugins extend WordPress functionality. From simple contact forms to complex e-commerce solutions, plugins are the backbone of WordPress customization. Learning to develop plugins opens endless possibilities.

attributes.title: Chocolate Chip Cookie Recipe
attributes.content:
Ingredients:

  • 2¼ cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 cup butter, softened
  • ¾ cup granulated sugar
  • ¾ cup packed brown sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 tsp vanilla extract
  • 2 cups chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C)
  2. Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl
  3. Beat butter and sugars until creamy
  4. Add eggs and vanilla, beat well
  5. Gradually blend in flour mixture
  6. Stir in chocolate chips
  7. Drop rounded tablespoons onto ungreased cookie sheets
  8. Bake 9-11 minutes until golden brown
  9. Cool on baking sheet for 2 minutes
  10. Remove to wire rack to cool completely

examples.name: Content Expands Below Toggle (contentExpandDir: above)
examples.description: Content expands upward, toggle button stays at bottom
examples.visualDescription: 'Read More' button at bottom, content expands upward when clicked, button position remains fixed

attributes.content:
This content will expand upward from the toggle button. This is useful when you want the toggle button to remain in a fixed position at the bottom of a section, while additional content appears above it.

Common use cases include footer widgets, sidebar information boxes, or sticky bottom sections where you want the button to stay visible.

validationRules.block_id: Required, unique identifier for the block
validationRules.templates: Required when contentSource='template', reusable block ID
validationRules.contentMaxHeight: Recommended 80-300px for optimal UX, responsive object
validationRules.expandText: Required, default 'Read More', max 30 characters recommended
validationRules.collapseText: Required, default 'Read Less', max 30 characters recommended
validationRules.contentExpandDir: Must be 'above' (default, content expands upward) or custom
validationRules.transDuration: String number, 200-500ms recommended for smooth UX
validationRules.customOpacity: Boolean, enables gradient overlay fade effect
validationRules.opacityHeight: Only used if customOpacity=true, height of gradient
validationRules.opacityColor: Only used if customOpacity=true, bottom color of gradient
validationRules.extraButtonLink: Required if extraButton=true, object with url/target/nofollow

warnings: NEVER modify block_id - it's the unique identifier
contentSource='template' requires valid templates ID or block won't render
contentMaxHeight too small (<50px) creates poor UX, users can't read content
contentMaxHeight too large (>500px) defeats purpose of expand functionality
Setting customOpacity=true without opacityColor creates invisible gradient
extraButton=true without extraButtonLink.url creates broken link
Empty expandText or collapseText creates buttons with no label (accessibility issue)
iconPosition affects spacing - always set toggleIconOffsetBefore or toggleIconOffsetAfter
contentExpandDir='above' is unusual - content expands upward from button position
commonMistakes: Forgetting to set openTypography: 1 before setting titleTypo or toggleBtnTypo values
Using contentSource='template' but not providing templates ID
Setting extraButton=true but forgetting to configure extraButtonLink
Not providing customOpacity gradient but expecting fade effect
Using px units for font sizes (prefer rem/em for accessibility)
Not testing responsive contentMaxHeight values on mobile (xs breakpoint)
Setting contentMaxHeight=0 for FAQ pattern but forgetting to hide content initially
Copying readMoreIcon/collapseIcon from examples without verifying FontAwesome class exists
Not considering ARIA labels (ariaLabel, ariaLabelEb) for screen readers
Using very long expandText/collapseText that breaks layout on mobile
bestPractices: Use contentMaxHeight between 100-250px for optimal user experience
Enable customOpacity gradient for visual indication of hidden content
Set responsive contentMaxHeight (md/sm/xs) for better mobile experience
Use semantic titleTag (h2-h4) for SEO and accessibility
Keep expandText/collapseText concise (2-3 words: 'Read More', 'Show Less')
Use meaningful ARIA labels for screen reader accessibility
Match icon semantics (angle-down for expand, angle-up for collapse)
Set transDuration 300-400ms for smooth, professional animations
Use extraButton sparingly - only when secondary action truly needed
Test with real content length - ensure gradient fade doesn't cut mid-sentence
For FAQ sections: set contentMaxHeight=0 to hide all content initially
For blog excerpts: show 2-3 lines (100-150px) to give content preview
Center-align toggle buttons for symmetric layouts
Left-align for sidebar widgets and compact layouts
Use contentExpandDir='above' only when button must stay at bottom (footer, sticky sections)

layoutContext.expandBehavior: Content height animates from contentMaxHeight to full height when toggle clicked
layoutContext.collapseBehavior: Content height animates back to contentMaxHeight when collapse clicked
layoutContext.gradientOverlay: If customOpacity=true, CSS ::after pseudo-element creates gradient from transparent to opacityColor over opacityHeight
layoutContext.contentExpandDir: 'above' (default) expands content upward, toggle button stays at bottom; other values may expand downward
layoutContext.toggleButtonLayout: Flexbox container with justify-content based on toggleAlignment (left/center/right)
layoutContext.extraButtonLayout: If extraButton=true, both buttons display side-by-side in same flex container
layoutContext.iconPositioning: iconPosition='before' adds icon before text with margin-right offset, 'after' adds after with margin-left
layoutContext.responsiveBehavior: contentMaxHeight, typography, spacing all respect md/sm/xs breakpoints
layoutContext.backendVisi: If true, template content visible in editor (useful for previewing template-based content)

performanceConsiderations: Template content (contentSource='template') adds database query - use sparingly
Very long content strings increase block save time - consider template approach
transDuration >500ms can feel sluggish on slower devices
Multiple expand blocks on single page - limit to 5-8 for performance
Gradient overlay (customOpacity) adds CSS ::after element - minimal performance impact
accessibilityNotes: Always set ariaLabel for toggle button screen reader context
If using extraButton, set ariaLabelEb for secondary button context
Use semantic titleTag (h2-h6) for proper heading hierarchy
Ensure expandText/collapseText are descriptive ('Read More' better than 'More')
Color contrast: ensure toggleBtnColor vs toggleBtnBg meets WCAG AA (4.5:1 ratio)
Icon-only buttons are inaccessible - always include text with icons
Test keyboard navigation - toggle button must be focusable and activate on Enter/Space
relatedBlocks: tpgb/tp-accordion - For multiple expandable sections with titles
tpgb/tp-tabs-tours - For switching between multiple content panels
tpgb/tp-switcher - For A/B toggle between two content states
tpgb/tp-pro-paragraph - For static content without expand functionality
